alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clinton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 3:23PM EDT until June 25 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON AND NORTHWESTERN BOONE COUNTIES... At 322 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of Frankfort, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Kirklin. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 144 and 152. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
